intro: Metastelma penicillatum, commonly known as the slender spider-orchid, is a rare and delicate orchid species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories or rocky crevices. Its botanical features include a complex root system and a unique floral structure that aids in pollination by specific insect species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
